page.title: 13GEOGRAPHY OF DALBEATTIE
page.content: Dalbeattie is situated in the valley of the River Urr.On each side of the river there are hills of igneous rock sloping upwards to a height of 500-600 feet.On the lower parts the land is fertile and is cultivated by the local farmers who grow wheat, barley and grass on it. As the ground rises the land is more suited to grazing for sheep and cattle.The most common cattle to be found are Friesian & Galloway although some Charollais have been introduced in the last few years. The sheep are mainly Blackfaces. Where the land is not suitable for grazing, trees have been planted.These are mainly pine, spruce & fir forests although there are some woods of other trees such as birch and beech. Many people work in light industries as well as in retail and catering.
